info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 1:56PM EST until January 09 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Transylvania County in western North Carolina... * Until 600 PM EST. * At 156 PM EST, The French Broad river gage at Rosman had crested at nearly 3 feet above flood stage and will slowly recede throughout the late afternoon. A gradual receding of floodwaters throughout Rosman is expected. The Davidson River also had crested, about 2 feet above flood stage and the river level will slowly fall through late afternoon. The Little River at Cedar Mountain is still rising and flooding along the river to the French Broad confluence will continue. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Heavy rain is increasing the risk of landslides, especially in areas where slides have occurred in the past. Be especially alert if you are near a stream, especially at the base of a mountain or in a cove. Watch for loose-moving soil and rocks or a sudden increase in streamflow. Leave the area quickly if this is observed. When driving along roads where the terrain is steep or rocky, watch and listen for falling rocks, mud, trees and other debris. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
